title: FBLA Computer Problem Solving Comprehensive Practice
description: 150 updated questions aligned with the 2025-2026 Competitive Events Guidelines.

questions.text: Which Windows 11 feature allows users to organize open applications into separate desktop environments for better productivity?
What is the primary purpose of the 'chmod' command when managing files within a Linux-based terminal environment?
options: To modify the owner and group of a file
To change the read, write, and execute permissions
To move files between different directory paths
To delete hidden system configuration files

questions.text: When a Windows system encounters a 'Stop Error' (BSOD), which of the following is the most effective initial troubleshooting step?
options: Immediately performing a clean installation of the OS
Replacing the primary system motherboard and CPU
Recording the specific error code provided on the screen
Updating all peripheral device drivers simultaneously

questions.text: Which file system is required to support volumes larger than 32GB and individual files larger than 4GB on modern Windows systems?
Which macOS utility is specifically designed to manage passwords, certificates, and secure notes across the operating system?
In a 64-bit operating system, what is the theoretical maximum amount of RAM that can be addressed by the processor?
Which command-line tool in Windows provides detailed information about the system's DirectX components and drivers?
What is the function of the 'Page File' (pagefile.sys) within the Windows memory management architecture?
options: Storing temporary internet browser cache files
Acting as virtual memory to extend physical RAM
Indexing files for faster search results locally
Recording system event logs for administrative review

questions.text: Which of the following is a key characteristic of an 'Open Source' operating system like Ubuntu Linux?
options: The software is provided for free but cannot be modified
The source code is publicly available for modification
Technical support is provided exclusively by the manufacturer
Proprietary drivers are required for all hardware components

questions.text: Which Windows administrative tool is used to manage hard drives, including creating partitions and formatting volumes?
What does the 'SFC /scannow' command accomplish when executed in an elevated Command Prompt window?
options: Scans for malware and viruses in the boot sector
Checks and repairs corrupted Windows system files
Analyzes the hard drive for physical sector errors
Optimizes the system registry for faster boot times

questions.text: Which of the following describes a 'distro' in the context of the Linux operating system?
options: A specific hardware driver for peripheral devices
A version of the OS bundled with software and tools
A specialized command for distributing system updates
A network protocol used for file sharing between nodes

questions.text: Which registry hive contains configuration information specific to the currently logged-in user?
What is the purpose of the 'Safe Mode' boot option in the Windows operating system?
options: To run the OS with the highest possible security settings
To start the system with only essential drivers and services
To bypass the user login screen for administrative access
To disable all network connections for offline work

questions.text: Which tool allows a user to automate the execution of programs or scripts at specific times or intervals?
Which file extension is commonly associated with an executable installation package on a macOS system?
What is the primary function of the 'Kernel' in a modern operating system?
options: Providing the graphical user interface for the user
Managing communication between hardware and software
Connecting the computer to local and wide area networks
Editing the system registry and configuration files

questions.text: Which Windows feature uses a small amount of flash memory to improve system performance by caching disk data?
In Linux, which directory typically stores global system configuration files?
What is the purpose of the 'msconfig' utility in Windows?
options: To manage hardware drivers and resource conflicts
To troubleshoot the system startup and boot process
To edit the binary data within the system registry
To monitor real-time CPU and memory utilization

questions.text: Which Windows 11 feature allows users to run Android applications directly on the desktop?
Which command would you use in a Linux terminal to display the current working directory path?
What is the default browser included with Windows 11 based on the Chromium engine?
Which of the following describes a 'Clean Install' of an operating system?
options: Installing the OS over an existing version while keeping files
Installing the OS on a freshly formatted drive or partition
Using a recovery partition to reset the OS to factory defaults
Running the OS from a live USB drive without installation

questions.text: Which tool in macOS is used to create backups of the entire system on an external drive?
What is the function of the 'root' user account in a Linux operating system?
options: A guest account with limited access to system folders
The superuser account with full administrative access
The default account created for basic office productivity
A hidden account used only for remote network access

questions.text: Which Windows feature provides a consistent way to manage various management consoles via a single interface?
What happens when you 'End Task' for a non-responsive application in the Windows Task Manager?
options: The computer immediately restarts to clear the error
The OS terminates the process and clears its memory
The application is uninstalled to prevent future issues
The application is put into a suspended sleep state

questions.text: Which tool would you use to view the history of system errors, warnings, and information messages?
What is the primary difference between a 'Workgroup' and a 'Domain' in Windows networking?
options: Workgroups require a server; Domains are peer-to-peer
Domains use centralized administration via Active Directory
Workgroups support up to 100 users; Domains support only 10
Domains are used for home networking; Workgroups for business

questions.text: Which command is used to terminate a running process in a Linux environment?
Which utility allows you to see exactly which files a process is accessing in real-time?
What is the purpose of 'Windows Update' in maintaining an operating system?
options: To upgrade the hardware components of the PC automatically
To deliver security patches and software improvements
To back up user data to the Microsoft cloud services
To clear temporary files and speed up the hard drive

questions.text: Which of the following is a symptom of a 'Memory Leak' in an operating system?
options: The hard drive runs out of physical storage space
An application consumes more RAM over time without releasing it
The computer loses power suddenly during high-intensity tasks
The monitor flickers and displays distorted graphical images

questions.text: Which Linux command displays a real-time, dynamic view of running system processes?
Which feature in Windows allows a user to return the computer's system files to an earlier point in time?
What is the maximum file size supported by the FAT32 file system?
Which file system is native to macOS for SSD-based computers?
Which of the following network devices operates primarily at Layer 3 of the OSI Model to direct traffic between different networks?
What is the primary function of the Domain Name System (DNS) on the internet?
options: Translating human-readable names to IP addresses
Assigning dynamic IP addresses to local clients
Filtering malicious traffic before it enters a LAN

questions.text: Which protocol is used by a client to automatically obtain an IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway from a server?
Which of the following IP addresses is considered a private address within a Class C network range?
What is the purpose of a Subnet Mask in TCP/IP networking?
options: To hide the IP address from unauthorized external users
To distinguish the network portion from the host portion
To identify the physical MAC address of the device
To route traffic between two different geographical areas

questions.text: Which command-line tool is used to test the connectivity between two devices by sending ICMP Echo Request packets?
Which wireless security standard provides the strongest encryption and is currently the industry standard?
What is the function of the 'Default Gateway' in a small home or office network configuration?
options: Providing the wireless signal for mobile devices
Routing traffic from the local network to the internet
Storing locally cached copies of frequently visited sites
Assigning MAC addresses to newly connected hardware

questions.text: Which network topology connects all devices to a single central cable, which is terminated at both ends?
What is the primary advantage of using Fiber Optic cabling over standard Twisted Pair (Copper) cabling?
options: Lower cost of installation and maintenance
Easier termination of connectors in the field
Higher power delivery via Power over Ethernet

questions.text: Which port number is standard for the Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)?
Which device is used to connect multiple computers within a local area network (LAN) by using MAC addresses to forward data?
What does an IP address starting with 169.254.x.x typically indicate about a computer's network status?
options: The computer is successfully connected to the internet
The computer has assigned itself an APIPA address
The computer is connected to a secure VPN tunnel
The computer has a manual static IP address assigned

questions.text: Which protocol is primarily used for sending email messages from a client to a server?
Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating sessions between applications?
Which of the following identifies a unique physical address assigned to a network interface controller (NIC)?
What is the purpose of the 'tracert' (Trace Route) command-line utility?
options: To determine the path a packet takes to reach a destination
To find the geographical location of an IP address
To change the DNS server settings of the local host
To speed up the connection to a remote web server

questions.text: Which of the following wireless frequencies provides faster data rates but has a shorter effective range and less wall penetration?
What is 'Latencey' in the context of computer networking?
options: The total amount of data transferred per second
The time delay for data to travel from source to destination
The physical length of the network cable used
The number of devices connected to a single access point

questions.text: Which protocol is used to securely log into and manage a remote server via a command-line interface?
What is the function of a Firewall on a network?
options: To increase the speed of the internet connection
To monitor and filter incoming and outgoing traffic
To provide power to network devices through cables
To translate web addresses into binary code

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of the UDP (User Datagram Protocol) compared to TCP?
options: It provides guaranteed delivery of all packets
It is connectionless and does not require a handshake
It automatically retransmits any lost data packets
It uses a larger header to ensure data integrity

questions.text: Which type of network spans a large geographical area, such as a city, country, or the entire world?
What does 'Full Duplex' communication mean in networking?
options: Data can only be sent in one direction at a time
Data can be sent and received simultaneously
Data is broadcast to all devices on the network
Data is encrypted using two different security keys

questions.text: Which cable type is most commonly used for Gigabit Ethernet in a modern office environment?
What is the purpose of Port Forwarding on a router?
options: To change the MAC address of a local computer
To direct external traffic to a specific internal device
To block all traffic from a specific country or region
To allow multiple routers to share a single IP address

questions.text: Which layer of the OSI model does a Hub primarily operate at?
What is the standard length of an IPv6 address?
Which network service translates private internal IP addresses to a public external IP address?
What is the maximum length of a standard Ethernet cable (Cat 5e/6) before a repeater or switch is required?
Which component is considered the 'brain' of the computer, responsible for executing instructions and processing data?
Which type of memory is 'volatile,' meaning its contents are lost when the power is turned off?
Which power supply connector is primarily used to provide power to modern high-end graphics cards (GPUs)?
What is the main advantage of a Solid State Drive (SSD) over a traditional Hard Disk Drive (HDD)?
options: Higher storage capacity for a lower price per GB
Faster data access speeds and better durability

questions.text: Which expansion slot on a motherboard is most commonly used for modern video cards due to its high bandwidth?
What is the primary function of the BIOS/UEFI on a computer system?
options: To manage user files and directory structures
To initialize and test hardware during the boot process
To perform complex mathematical calculations for the CPU

questions.text: Which component is used to dissipate heat from the CPU using a metal structure and a fan?
Which interface is used to connect an internal SSD directly to the motherboard via a small, flat slot for maximum speed?
What does 'Overclocking' a CPU refer to?
options: Increasing the clock speed beyond the factory rating
Installing multiple processors on a single motherboard
Reducing the power consumption to save energy
Synchronizing the system clock with an internet server

questions.text: Which type of RAM is typically used in laptop computers due to its smaller physical size?
What is the purpose of the 'CMOS Battery' on a computer motherboard?
options: To provide emergency power for the entire computer
To maintain the BIOS settings and system clock
To speed up the charging of mobile peripheral devices
To power the cooling fans when the PC is in sleep mode

questions.text: Which video connector type is capable of carrying both high-definition video and multi-channel audio signals?
What is the function of the Northbridge chipset on older motherboards?
options: Managing low-speed peripherals like keyboards and mice
Controlling communication between the CPU and RAM
Providing power to the internal hard disk drives
Handling the audio and network interface functions

questions.text: Which level of CPU cache is the smallest, fastest, and located closest to the processor cores?
What is the purpose of 'ECC' (Error Correction Code) memory?
options: To increase the speed of data transfers in gaming PCs
To detect and correct common types of internal data corruption
To allow memory to work even if a RAM module is missing
To encrypt the data stored in RAM for better security

questions.text: Which standard defines the physical dimensions and mounting points for computer motherboards and cases?
What is the primary purpose of applying thermal paste between the CPU and the heat sink?
options: To glue the heat sink permanently to the CPU
To fill microscopic air gaps and improve heat transfer
To protect the CPU pins from bending during installation
To provide electrical insulation between components

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of an 'Output Device'?
Which storage technology uses mirrored drives to provide data redundancy, ensuring no data is lost if one drive fails?
What does 'S.M.A.R.T.' stand for in the context of hard drive technology?
Which port type is most commonly used for connecting mice, keyboards, and external drives today?
What is the function of the 'Power Supply Unit' (PSU) in a computer?
options: To store electrical energy for use during power outages
To convert AC power from the wall into DC power for the PC
To regulate the temperature of the internal components
To amplify the audio signal sent to the speakers

questions.text: Which component is responsible for generating the images displayed on the monitor?
What is the purpose of the 'Reset Button' on a computer case?
options: To clear the hard drive of all user data
To force a hardware reboot without cutting power
To return the BIOS settings to factory defaults
To log the current user out of the operating system

questions.text: Which of the following is a symptom of a failing Power Supply Unit?
options: The computer displays a 'No Operating System Found' error
The system randomly reboots or shuts down under load
The mouse cursor moves slowly or lags across the screen
The monitor displays 'No Signal' while the PC is on

questions.text: What does the 'Wattage' rating of a Power Supply indicate?
options: The physical size and weight of the PSU unit
The maximum power the unit can deliver to components
The speed at which the internal cooling fan spins
The number of devices that can be connected via USB

questions.text: Which interface is used to connect a monitor using a 15-pin, D-shaped blue connector?
What is 'Hyper-Threading' technology in Intel CPUs?
options: A way to combine two physical CPUs into one socket
Allowing a single core to execute two threads at once
An automatic method for cleaning the CPU's cache
A feature that increases the voltage for more speed

questions.text: Which hardware device is used to protect a computer from power surges and provide temporary power during a blackout?
Which type of malware is designed to encrypt a user's files and demand payment for the decryption key?
What is 'Phishing' in the context of cybersecurity?
options: Attempting to crash a server by flooding it with traffic
Using deceptive emails to steal sensitive information
Installing hidden software to track a user's keystrokes
Gaining physical access to a secure server room

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of 'Multi-Factor Authentication' (MFA)?
options: Using a long password with symbols and numbers
Using both a password and a code from a mobile app
Using two different passwords for the same account
Sharing your password with a trusted administrator

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a 'VPN' (Virtual Private Network)?
options: To increase the speed of the local internet connection
To create a secure, encrypted tunnel over a public network
To block all advertisements while browsing the web
To provide a free internet connection in public places

questions.text: Which of the following describes 'Social Engineering'?
options: Writing code that exploits a vulnerability in a browser
Manipulating people into giving up confidential info
Setting up a network of computers to perform tasks
Designing a website to be more user-friendly

questions.text: What is a 'Trojan Horse' in computer security?
options: A virus that replicates itself across an entire network
Malicious software disguised as a legitimate program
An attack that tries every possible password combination
A hardware device that monitors network traffic

questions.text: Which security measure involves converting data into an unreadable format that can only be reversed with a key?
What is a 'Brute Force' attack?
options: Using physical force to gain access to a computer
Attempting to crack a password by trying every possibility
Sending a large amount of spam to a single email address
Stealing a computer and selling it for parts

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of a 'Strong Password'?
options: It contains the user's name or date of birth
It uses a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
It is exactly eight characters long and all lowercase
It is a common word found in the dictionary

questions.text: What is the function of 'Antivirus' software?
options: To speed up the computer's processing power
To detect, quarantine, and remove malicious software
To provide a backup of the user's personal files
To manage the network connections of the PC

questions.text: Which of the following describes 'Shoulder Surfing'?
options: Looking over someone's shoulder to see their password
Connecting to an unsecured public Wi-Fi network
Using a computer while standing up at a desk
Interposing a device between a user and a server

questions.text: What is a 'Firewall' designed to do?
options: Extinguish physical fires in the server room
Filter network traffic based on security rules
Scan downloaded files for potential viruses

questions.text: Which type of malware records every key pressed by the user to steal credentials?
What is 'Tailgating' in a physical security context?
options: Working on a computer while sitting in a car
Following an authorized person into a secure area
Installing software on multiple computers at once
Leaving a computer unattended while logged in

questions.text: What does 'HTTPS' indicate when seen in a browser's address bar?
options: The website is faster than a standard site
The connection to the website is encrypted
The website is owned by a verified government
The website is free to use and has no ads

questions.text: Which of the following is a 'Zero-Day' vulnerability?
options: A security flaw that has existed for over a year
A flaw that is unknown to the software developer
A vulnerability that only affects mobile devices
A password that must be changed every 24 hours

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'Data Sanitization'?
options: Cleaning the dust off of physical hard drives
Permanently removing data so it cannot be recovered
Organizing files into folders for easier access
Compressing files to save space on the disk

questions.text: Which type of attack involves redirecting a user from a legitimate website to a fake one by poisoning DNS records?
What is a 'Rootkit'?
options: A set of tools used to repair a broken OS
Malware that gains high-level system access while hiding
A physical device used to lock a computer to a desk
The initial set of files needed to boot a computer

questions.text: Which principle suggests that users should only have the minimum level of access necessary for their job?
What is a 'Spyware' program?
options: Software that helps users find the best deals online
Software that secretly monitors user activity
Software that protects the PC from hackers
Software used by the government to track criminals

questions.text: Which of the following describes 'Bio-metrics'?
options: Using physical characteristics like fingerprints for auth
Measuring the electrical usage of a computer system
Calculating the lifespan of hardware components
Studying the impact of computers on human health

questions.text: What is a 'Man-in-the-Middle' (MitM) attack?
options: An attacker sitting between two users in an office
An attacker intercepting communication between two parties
A server that is located between two different networks
A software bug that causes a delay in data transfer

questions.text: Which type of screen technology is commonly used in mobile devices because it doesn't require a backlight and can produce true blacks?
What is the primary purpose of the 'Digitizer' in a tablet or smartphone?
options: To convert analog audio signals into digital data
To translate touch input into digital signals
To improve the resolution of the built-in camera
To encrypt the data stored on the internal flash chip

questions.text: Which component in a laptop is responsible for converting DC power from the battery into AC power for the CCFL backlight?
Which of the following is a common symptom of a failing laptop battery?
options: The laptop shuts down immediately when unplugged
The keys on the keyboard begin to stick

questions.text: What is the function of the 'Fn' (Function) key on a laptop keyboard?
options: To perform a 'Force Next' command in applications
To access secondary functions like brightness or volume
To format the hard drive during the boot sequence
To toggle between the primary and secondary batteries

questions.text: Which small expansion card is typically used in laptops to provide Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity?
What is 'Tethering' in the context of mobile devices?
options: Physically locking a laptop to a desk with a cable
Sharing a mobile device's data connection with others
Syncing a tablet with a desktop computer via cloud
Charging a mobile device using a wireless pad

questions.text: Which technology allows mobile devices to make payments by tapping them against a compatible terminal?
What is the primary difference between a 'Tablet' and a 'Laptop'?
options: Tablets always have more storage than laptops
Tablets primarily use a touchscreen interface
Laptops cannot connect to cellular networks
Tablets do not have internal processors or RAM

questions.text: Which component is often built into the bezel of a laptop screen to provide wireless signal reception?
What does 'Airplane Mode' do on a mobile device?
options: Increases the battery life by dimming the screen
Automatically connects to the airport's public Wi-Fi
Enables a special GPS mode for high-altitude tracking

questions.text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of an 'Internal' laptop battery compared to a 'Removable' one?
options: Internal batteries have a much shorter lifespan
It is more difficult for a user to replace it themselves
Internal batteries provide less power to the CPU
It causes the laptop to be much heavier and bulkier

questions.text: What is a 'Docking Station' used for with a laptop?
options: To charge the laptop's battery faster than a cable
To connect a laptop to multiple desktop peripherals
To provide a cooling surface for high-performance use
To protect the laptop from physical damage during travel

questions.text: Which sensor in a smartphone allows the screen to rotate based on how the device is held?
What is the purpose of a 'Stylus' when used with a tablet?
options: To clean the screen of fingerprints and smudges
To provide more precise input than a finger
To extend the range of the Bluetooth antenna
To act as a physical key to unlock the device

questions.text: Which printer technology uses a laser beam to create an electrostatic image on a drum?
In a laser printer, what is the purpose of the 'Fuser Assembly'?
options: To spray liquid ink onto the paper surface
To melt the toner powder onto the paper using heat
To clean the excess toner from the imaging drum
To pull the paper from the tray into the printer

questions.text: Which type of printer is most commonly used for printing receipts because it requires no ink or toner?
What is the primary cause of 'ghosting' (faint images of previous pages) in a laser printer?
options: Low ink levels in the primary color cartridges
A damaged imaging drum or cleaning blade
Using the wrong type of paper for the print job
A clogged print head that needs to be aligned

questions.text: Which connection type is the most common standard for connecting a printer directly to a computer today?
What is 'Duplexing' in the context of professional printers?
options: Printing on both sides of a sheet of paper
Printing in two different colors at the same time
Connecting two printers to a single computer
Printing two copies of a document automatically

questions.text: Which maintenance task is unique to inkjet printers to prevent streaks in the printed output?
What does 'PPM' stand for when measuring printer performance?
Which peripheral device is used to convert physical documents into digital image files?
What is a 'KVM Switch' used for in a computer setup?
options: To share one set of peripherals among multiple PCs
To increase the speed of a keyboard and mouse
To convert a VGA signal into an HDMI signal
To protect the computer from electrical surges

questions.text: Which type of printer uses a ribbon and a series of small pins to strike the paper?
What is the purpose of a 'Printer Driver'?
options: To physically move the paper through the printer
To allow the OS to communicate with the printer
To store the ink and toner used during printing
To provide power to the printer's internal motor

questions.text: What should you do if a laser printer starts producing vertical white lines on the page?
options: Gently shake the toner cartridge to redistribute it
Clean the print heads with a damp cloth
Increase the print resolution in the settings

questions.text: Which of the following is considered an 'Input' peripheral?
